conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for Chapter 12 of the main campaign and for the Forgotten Truths event.
What is our status?
Sir, our troops have finished supplying food and water to the villages of Alberia.
Further, plans proceed apace on the reparations for lost homes and fields.
We've also secured funding sources for the solatia due the people. All that remains now is distribution.
And how do our defenses fare?
Reinforcement proceeds without issue, Your Highness. As instructed, we have deployed troops to key locations. All are prepared to mobilize.
Good.
Your Highness, please pardon the intrusion. It is time for the public hearing.
Right. I'll be there anon.
His Majesty Leonidas certainly has... changed.
You can say that again. He used to be totally heedless of other people.
Praise be to him for courting the opinions of the people firsthand. Truly, I am grateful.
Indeed. I was uneasy at first; to him, power was first and last in all matters back when he governed Valkaheim.
What circumstances could have brought on his sudden change, I wonder.
Hm... Why DID he change so suddenly?
You mean Leonidas? Yeah, he's become a pretty stand-up guy lately. Talk about a heel turn.
Guy prolly got tired of gettin' his butt handed to him in his feud with Euden.
He was so cold-blooded before, it woulda given a lizard a run for its rupies. Guess he grew a heart.
If I'm not mistaken, his goal was a world unfettered by the yoke of dragons.
Correct. Could he have abandoned that cause?
Goodness. Do you think my dear brother Leonidas is so mercurial a man?
I mean, he changed his tune faster than a conductor with a caffeine buzz. Are you saying there's something more to it?
Not at all. In fact, I would assert that he is the same man you've always known.
No way, lady. It's night and day. He's acting like an actual good ruler now.
It is unwise to judge a person's character by the mask they wear on the surface.
My brother believes that might makes right, and he would do anything to uphold that view. That's who he really is.
In other words, what has changed are his means—not the ideals at his core.
So you think that becoming a nice guy is part of some strategy he cooked up to make his freaky dreams come true?
Meaning that his aim is, as ever, to dismantle the dragons' hegemony over our world?
He had some pretty serious beef with Euden. You sayin' that hostility is still there?
Who can say, my dears?
Oh, c'mon, give us a straight answer!
I am not the master of my brother's thoughts. He is difficult to understand— a man with profound depth.
But what I can say is this: without him, we would be unable to depart southern Grastaea and travel north as we have been.
Rather than casting the eye of suspicion upon him, oughn't we be grateful instead?
I suppose you're right...
But even if his goal hasn't changed, it's still a mystery as to WHY he switched up his methods.
Do we have any other clues, aside from how he lost to Euden?
Nothing springs to mind. Chelle, any ideas?
I have nothing, I'm afraid. But I do believe he was spurred on by a catalyst of sorts.
I suspect that the world may be shifting in ways and places unknown to us.
It is your turn, Ilia.
I'm thinking. Don't rush me.
Leonidas, why did you make that move?
If I divulged that, the move itself would lose its value.
Ha ha. It's clear you're after something. I just struggle to see what that all-important something may be.
Now that I think of it...are you aware that similar sentiment has been echoing through the streets of late?
Go on.
They say His Majesty Prince Leonidas has suddenly changed. The people are all guessing at what you might be thinking.
They know that the great first scion of Alberia must have something in the back of his mind that drives him forward.
But there are none who know the truth of it. None besides the two of us, of course.
What are you insinuating?
I swear, if eyes were daggers, yours would've cut me to shreds by now. ...I'm just saying I'm happy, that's all.
Happy that you accepted us and our sudden appearance.
And that you believed my tale.
Anyway, that's enough of that. It's time to attack.
Don't you think you're being reckless?
I won't know 'til I try. Even a stray shot can blast open a locked door. You just have to be ready to step through.
I mean, think back to that fateful night.
My recklessness got me exactly where I needed to be: rubbing elbows with you.
Hrgh!
(Pain sears my flesh like spreading fire...)
(This wound stands as proof of my brother's victory.)
My brother, of all people...
(He and I have been completely unalike since we were but mewling babes.)
(I am fundamentally unable to understand the way he thinks and acts.)
(I thought him soft. He burdens himself with the welfare of others. Relies on them. I believed it was the pinnacle of stupidity.)
(And yet who should emerge victorious from our bitter struggle? Not I, but him.)
(In victory lies verity. Which means I must acknowledge that Euden was right.)
But I will not give in. I will not submit to draconic tyranny!
(Defeated or not, my objective remains the same. Whatever method I must resort to, I WILL dismantle their reign.)
Whoops! Zigged when I should've zagged!
*sigh*
Who goes there?
Wait! We're not up to no good, promise!
I am not sure this particular entrance lends you much credibility.
Aha ha... Guess not.
Prince Leonidas! Who are these people?!
Welp. So much for diplomacy. Take a nap, fella.
Yah!
Urgh!
Why, you...
Don't worry. He's not dead—just taking a little snooze. I got him with a special tranquilizer caster of mine.
Ah?!
That was close... He just grazed us.
I suspect that was intentional.
But hey, where'd he get that caster? They shouldn't be widespread in this era.
＂This era,＂ you say? Who ARE you? From whence do you come?
Tell me your aims, your origins; all of it. Or I assure you my next shot will not miss its mark.
*whistle* Guy's covered in wounds, but he's got spunk to spare, huh?
Spilling suits me just fine. You'll want to sit down for this one, though.
I'll tell you about the true history we saw...down to the very last detail.
Maaan, what a night. Talk about a heart-pounding run-in!
And yet you didn't think to ask your passenger if he was prone to arrhythmia. Your reckless driving got us into quite a serious mess.
You'll never understand the need for speed, Mordecai. NEED. FOR. SPEED!
Focus on the board. My turn is over. You're up.
Yeah, yeah. Now, take a look. That move you called ＂reckless＂ is slowly but surely getting me somewhere.
I've spread across the board. The real game starts now.
Hmph.
Just like what we did that night, these sorts of crazy plans can be surprisingly effective.
You are a fool, and your heedlessness will be your ruin one day.
D'awww, are you worried about me? Don't worry. It'll be fine.
For better or worse, I have the Holywyrm Elysium backing me up.
Okay, your move.
Yes, very well.
(The Holywyrm Elysium...)
That night, the girl who suddenly appeared before me spoke of a heretofore unknown reality.
Why had this young woman, an alchemist, come to be revered as the Goddess?
The story of how the Other was summoned. The truth about the Holywyrm Elysium.
Ilia told me everything about the world of a thousand years ago.
Yet even as she spoke of the past, she focused pointedly on the future.
Something about the powerful light glimmering in her eyes reminded me of Euden.
Where is the Holywyrm now?
I couldn't tell you.
You are pactbound, yet you know nothing of your pactwyrm?
My pactwyrm is the HOLYWYRM. It's a totally different story than the dragons you've got here.
Wherever Elysium is, it's not far from this world. It's faint...but I can feel it.
And that's why we came to this world.
I'm sure this world—standing as it is on the cusp of transcending order—would be very...inconvenient for Elysium.
Hmph. We have no need of the dragons' ＂order＂ and their unseen rule.
I would take it all to the flame. Until nothing is left.
Whoa, you had a move like that up your sleeve? Way to crank the intensity right to eleven!
I had you pegged as a pretty reserved player, but I guess you were just building up to this the whole time, huh?
Proper preparation before the decisive clash is fundamental.
...And does that apply to the fight with Elysium as well?
Naturally. The pieces are already in motion on that particular front.
So advancing your rule of southern Grastaea is in service to that, huh? But this is you we're talking about.
You're not planning on stopping there, are you?
I suspect that from your perspective, southern Grastaea is too small a board...
The final cobblestone on your bloody footpath... I'm guessing it's nothing short of total world domination.
...You read my moves well. I commend you.
Are we talking about chess here? Or...?
Both.
Right now, there are three great powers in southern Grastaea.
One, the Kingdom of Alberia. Two, the Kingdom of New Alberia, founded by my brother. And finally, the Dyrenell Empire.
First, from here in Valkaheim, I will rebuild the Kingdom of Alberia.
I have also been entrusted with the administration of New Alberia while my brother is away.
Dyrenell, for its part, has been weakened ever since the Other's disappearance.
Evidently, Emile has become the emperor, but...he is no threat. For the time being, we should be safe to simply observe.
The activities of the north and the Ilian Church pose some complications, but we will deal with them swiftly in turn.
So you've already worked out a means to capture the whole southern Grastaean board.
You think it'll all go that smoothly?
I know not. But I needn't worry.
There is a distinct pleasure in wresting control back from a plan gone awry and crushing your interloper without mercy.
Yeesh. You are one seriously nasty guy.
But you don't scare me! Time to attack again!
I suspected you would do that...which is why I molded the situation on the board accordingly.
Wait, what?!
Checkmate.
Oho. I didn't realize you had that move available. Splendid, Leonidas.
Baaaaah! I lost AGAIN! Why the heck can't I win even one game?!
I might not look like much, but I'm a genius, you know! At least, that's what everyone always used to tell me!
Ilia, you're only embarrassing yourself more...
Ugh, this is so annoying. When did you see your path to winning the game, anyway?
From the very start, obviously.
*sigh* I've gotta hand it to you. Guess that's why you're a famous conqueror.
I'm relieved you're on our side. From the bottom of my heart.
Hey, have you heard the word on the street about all the unrest lately?
In this town, you mean?
Guess that's a yes, then. So what, you're just gonna pretend like nothing's happening?
Valkaheim's no longer a strong-eat- the-weak kind of place, and all the former top dogs are starting to bark super loud. You're really okay with that?
But why are they agitated? Surely the policies which protect the strong have not changed.
All it means is that the weak can live in peace. Why would their ＂betters＂ be upset?
Great question, Mordecai. As for the answer...
Because people are foolish creatures.
Ding ding. Valkaheim is now a haven for the weak as well as the strong. And those at the top don't like that.
But why? That which they stand to gain remains unchanged.
They don't like knowing that anyone other than themselves gets to feel good.
They want to tread upon the unfortunate and stand cackling at the top of the heap. That's the kind of place this used to be. It attracted folks who believed that ethos.
Then all of a sudden, that changed. And folks not entirely convinced by the new direction are raising their voices.
I don't understand at all.
People can at times be incomprehensibly foolish.
So, Leonidas, what's the glorious ruler of those foolish people going to do about it?
You will know shortly.
I mean, I brought word to you precisely because the situation's already gotten as bad as it has. You can't keep burying your head in the sand here.
Do not attempt to give me orders.
He left. What could he be thinking?
Who knows. But if he's not going to do anything right now...
Valkaheim'll be up in flames before long.
(What are you scheming, Leonidas? What could your true intentions be?)
This is Valkaheim—a place where the strong eat the weak!
And if our lord has suddenly lost his teeth, then WE'LL dine in his stead!
The weak have no place here. Strength is everything!
The only people who deserve to be happy here are the ones with the power!
So it's begun.
Lots of people rallying around the idea of ＂strength.＂ They certainly look the part.
Isn't it about time you told us what you're plotting, Leonidas?
They're gonna march on us before long. We need a game plan, and fast.
This is Valkaheim. As they say, power is everything here.
Words will not avail us on fools. Thus, I will speak the only language they know... until I make them comprehend by force.
I have also called some of my brother's troops. It will not take long to suppress them.
I will crush them utterly, and teach you all the pleasure of a well-earned victory.
Your methods in reality are just as disturbing as they are in chess.
...Well, he says we can hit them with everything we've got. Let's do this, Mordecai.
Understood.
I will etch the reality of our hierarchy into their very flesh and bone!
Take this!
Have a taste of this!
Let the ember become a blaze! Go, Mars!
Hmph. A trifle.
Ahhh! It's gonna set us on fire!
What the hell kind of weapon's that lady shooting us with?!
The reinforcements from New Alberia are super tough, too...
They're too strong!
EEEK!
Now answer me! What does it mean to be strong?
T-to have lots of troops at your disposal?
Wrong. That is no more than mere muscle!
True strength is the power to guide the weak! To wield authority in the name of those who cannot fight for themselves!
No way... That's not the kind of place this was ever supposed to be!
True. For I was once like you. I believed that with strength alone, I could achieve my dreams.
But I was mistaken. My brother, who has something I lack, helped me understand.
There is no inherent folly in being strong. But power alone does not make dreams reality.
Your neighbors are not your enemy. Channel all of your strength into enriching the lives of your fellows!
Use your strength, your intellect, and all your capabilities to shepherd the weak!
Depending on your actions henceforth, I will give you what you want, whether it be wealth or status alike.
This is the new rule of Valkaheim!
Under normal circumstances, I would have already sentenced you rebels to death. But this time only, I will overlook your actions.
Know that my mercy is a one-time gift. Your lives have been spared. Do with them as you will. That is all.
Use the strength that I cultivated to rise up for someone else?
I thought my strength wasn't good for anything but fighting. Is he saying there are even broader applications?
But we ourselves don't have to do anything different, yeah?
We're still usin' our fists, we're just usin' them to protect the weak. Is that it?
The weak just moseyed through life all carefree, and it really got under my skin.
But you're saying that from now on, it's exactly BECAUSE those people exist that we can rise up in the world?
I like that! Let's DO it!
Agreed. Prince Leonidas saved my life, so it makes sense that I should use it in service to him!
Long live Prince Leonidas!
Well, color me impressed. Can't believe that was your aim all along.
Gather up all the rebels in one fell swoop, spare their lives, and get them indebted to you. Bing, bam, done.
And by requesting relief from the seventh scion's forces, you minimized the damage done to the city.
I was a little worried how things were gonna play out, but I couldn't come up with a more efficient method if I tried. And I'm an ALCHEMIST! I invent stuff!
That was one heck of a turnabout. Actually, no—just like in chess, you saw it coming. Right from the very beginning.
Naturally.
Leonidas is so cool...
Daring though it was, the outcome was perfect. Almost annoyingly so.
If only I could be like him.
Uh, please no. I can't even imagine what a headache it would be having a partner who's as tricky to read as that guy.
Still, it makes you wonder what kind of person the seventh scion is if he brought someone as fearsome as Leonidas to heel.
A system in which the strong lead the weak... The so-called ＂New Way of Valkaheim＂ spread quickly throughout the continent.
A system where strength could be used to the benefit of all was a good match for southern Grastaea at present.
The weak who tire of war and seek leadership, and the powerful who would take the mantle of shepherds...
Leonidas created a society in which both groups could live in symbiotic harmony.
Government has begun to function not only in large cities, but in small towns and villages as well.
Bit by steady bit, war-torn southern Grastaea began to show signs of recovery.
What are you reading, Leonidas?
Correspondence from Hinomoto. Why?
That's the island nation to the east, right? I didn't take you for a man of diplomacy.
We are still in the preparatory stages. Using my brother's messenger, I am establishing a line of communication.
Hrm. So the seventh scion's pretty good at statecrafty stuff, huh?
No. He has little interest in politics. But he is hopelessly addicted to helping people.
So you guys are like oil and water, then.
Aptly put. Though we were raised in the same palace, at some point our paths diverged.
(Maybe it was back then...)
Young Leonidas has been standing there for quite some time now.
One hardly need wonder why. Given this is his final farewell to his mother, I imagine it is difficult to leave the spot.
And the poor queen. To think she left to offer succor to a village ravaged by heavy rains only to be caught up in a tornado.
Honestly, these dragons! One would hardly think a torrent of rain would NEED be followed on by a powerful tornado, and yet, they saw fit to make it so.
Aye, it is known the dragons who govern nature bring forth blessing and misfortune in equal measure.
But to think such a fate might befall the queen of a nation so intrinsically tied to the blood of those very dragons...
Leonidas?
It's nothing.
More to the point, you have asked after my brother a great deal. Has your curiosity gotten the better of you?
I guess. I'd just like to know what kind of guy he is, given that he defeated you.
Though of course you're very cool yourself, Leonidas!
...What?
Sorry, my boy here can be too straightforward for his own good.
Anyway, Leonidas. We've appreciated everything you've done for us, but it's about time we were on our way.
...I see.
You taught me a lot about this era and helped me prepare for my journey.
And since I've left preparations to defeat Elysium to you, in all your excellence...
We're going to try and chase after the dragon itself.
Hm? I thought its location was unknown to you.
It is, for now. But if I follow the trail of Elysium from a thousand years ago, I should be able to catch up.
I hit the books to see what happened in our world after we left it.
Meene, the faerie who raised me as my mother and went on to become the Goddess Ilia... I'm going to pursue her and Elysium's footsteps.
A faerie, you say? So you head north.
Yep. Apparently, that's where the land of the faeries lies. I think we'll head there first in search of clues.
I see. You may well come face-to-face with my younger brother, then.
Yup. I'm looking forward to it. Anyway, see you around, green eyes.
Thank you, Leonidas. Until we meet again.
Each makes for their dreams...
(One that she may be freed from a fate ongoing...)
(The other that he may unearth the truth...)
(And I, so that I may free this world from the invisible shackles that bind it.)
I am no longer a powerless man who stands inert.
For myself, and for the world, I will march onward to fulfill my ambitions.
And I look forward to the day when our paths intersect once more...my brother.
